info.title: Ruby on Rails 3.2 - Step by Step

abstract.para: This is a step by step book to learn how to code Ruby 1.9 and use Ruby on Rails 3.2 to create modern web applications.

preface.title: Preface
preface.para: Don't let people fool you into believing that Ruby on Rails is easly to learn. It is not! It is the best and most effective Framework to develop webapplications but it is hard to understand in the beginning. The worst mistake of all is to not learn Ruby before diving into Ruby on Rails. Believe me. I made this one myself. You can understand PHP by reading it but you should learn Ruby before reading any code of a Ruby on Rails project.

This book starts with the basics of Ruby (). You will not become a Ruby guru after reading it but you'll understand the basic ideas and that is important. It is probalby wise to redo all code examples by yourself. By playing with the code snippets you'll learn the most.

I try to give each reader a sense of achievement as soon as possible by diving into creating a Rails application right after the chapter. Anyhow you'll have to invest a couple of hours probably a couple of days. It takes time to understand and feel the magic of Ruby on Rails. But once it happens you'll a lost soul for Java and PHP. ;-)

The book is written in a way that you can and actually should read it from the first to the last page. But is is also written like a cookbook with a lot of photos of the process. The photos are of course not photos but code examples. Anyhow each recipe works for it self. Once you understand the concept of cooking you don't have to start with the first recipe. You can dive into baking a cheesecake right away.

Please do me a favour and tell other people about this book. Help to spread the word by Twitter, Facebook and other social media plattforms. And please do not hesitate to send me feedback by e-mail to stefan.wintermeyer@amooma.de or Twitter (https://twitter.com/wintermeyer.). It helps me a lot to improve my work.
